titleStmt.title: Jesse Yeates et al. to Unknown
CWG9913

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned Jurors who tried the case of the Comwth against Jno Phelps for carrying concealed weapons & of which we convicted him at the present August term of the Montgomery circuit court Would ask Gov Magoffin to remit the same. It appeared on the trial that Phelps had contracted to sell the pistol which was owned by his son & had taken it to the place where we was bound with it concealed on his person to deliver it to the purchaser & get it out of his family -- but we were driven under our oaths to convict under the hard law as laid down by the court August 17th 1860

Jesse yeates
W Henry
D C Bedford
John Carrington
A B McConnler
John McClure
James H Trimble
C A Lindsey
John A. Adams
George N Botts
Joel McClure
W D Craig

Montgomery Cir. Ct.
Remitted
B. M
$50 } Concealed Weapons
John Phelps
Issd Jany 12 1861
